book.title: The Great Gatsby
book.Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
book.preface: The Great Gatsby is a novel by American author F. Scott Fitzgerald. First published in 1925, the story primarily concerns the young and mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his quixotic passion and obsession with the beautiful former debutante Daisy Buchanan.

chapter.title: Chapter 1: Nick Carraway's Arrival
chapter.summary: The novel begins with the narrator, Nick Carraway, introducing himself and recounting how he ended up in New York. He rents a small house in West Egg, Long Island, situated next to the mansion of Jay Gatsby, a mysterious and wealthy man.

sections.p: Nick describes the various characters inhabiting the area and his impressions of them, including his cousin Daisy and her husband Tom Buchanan, who live across the bay in East Egg.
